item.title: Taraleigh Steiner Preschool & Playgroup St. Nicholas Day Fair
item.description:
The Taraleigh Steiner Preschool & Playgroup St. Nicholas Day Fair is a community run annual event providing a great family day out.
The fair is held in the beautiful grounds of Taraleigh, there will be the usual community favourites such as a cake stall selling delicious treats, a raffle for a chance to win some great prizes, and a silent auction offering the chance to grab a bargain.
The craft market provides a treasure trove of gifts just in time for Christmas or to treat yourself with. Most of the stalls sell goods which are handmade, sustainably sourced and/or eco-friendly, in line with kinder's philosophy of Steiner Education. The Taraleigh Craft Group stall will have a range of beautiful handmade felt toys and crowns, ribbon wands and Advent Sticks all of which are lovingly created by parents of the Taraleigh community. The Playgroup parents will be running a second-hand book stall with bargains galore.
Entertainment includes live acoustic music, bongo drum workshop and traditional choir. There will be a storytelling session followed by a special visit by St. Nicholas for the kids, accompanied by a choir.
Kids activities include a sandpit treasure hunt, story time, candle rolling, and bags to tie dye. For the kids and adults we have a traditional Coconut Shy for everyone to try their luck at, how many coconuts will you be able to knock down?
There will be sausages in bread to snack on, dahl and rice for hungry tummies, and homemade lemonade cordial and Chai.

item.title: Framed Movements
item.description:
Presented by Melbourne Festival and Australian Centre for Contemporary Art, Framed Movements investigates the potential that lies at the shifting boundaries between dance and art.
Exploring the many ways a movement based approach to the occupation of time and space is practised not only in dance but increasingly in the realm of contemporary art, the exhibition brings together a series of Australian and international artists who use a choreographic approach in their work.
A series of performances will accompany the exhibition, drawing attention to the potential of the body in space and its ability to draw you into a physical conversation with the world around you.
Exhibiting artists: Gwenneth Boelens, Ann Carlson & Mary Ellen Strom, Lane Cormick, Brian Fuata, Alicia Frankovich, Agatha Gothe-Snape, Nathan Gray, Helen Grogan, Maria Hassabi, Joachim Koester, Paulina Olowska, Jess Olivieri, Hayley Forward & Parachutes for Ladies, Emily Roysdon, Sandra Selig and Lee Serle.

image.altText: Maria Hassabi, Intermission 2013. Courtesy the artist.

item.title: Imhoff: a life of grain & pixels
item.description:
An exhibition at the Art Gallery of Ballarat highlights the work of Robert Imhoff, an Australian photographer and filmmaker who not only built up a very successful career as a commercial photographer but also established a reputation as one of Australia's leading portrait photographers.
Imhoff's love affair with photography began in the same way as it did for many young photographers: with a Kodak Box Brownie, while his professional career started after studying photography at RMIT in the late 1960s.
A career break came when he was invited to do a four-page spread featuring Wittner Shoes for insertion in the March 1971 edition of Vogue Australia. The images featured shoes on model's feet that were draped around a naked female body. Although the shot featuring Gaye Baker doesn't show much flesh by today's standards, the use of the naked female form was seen as ground-breaking for Vogue Australia.
Imhoff tended to work for the upper end of the consumer market, undertaking commissions for perfume, cars, fashion and airlines.
This retrospective exhibition, Imhoff: A life of grains and pixels, documents his career as a professional photographer and filmmaker, including portraits of celebrities and the not so well known, photography for specialist food magazines that began to emerge in the 1970s, and assignments for a number of multinational companies.

image.altText: Imhoff: a life of grain & pixels

item.title: Stories in the Street
item.description:
As part of Children's Week, Stories in the Street will take place in the Mount Alexander Shire on Wednesday 22 October and Thursday 23 October. There will be storytellers in four different locations. The first one will be at Norwood Hill Playground, Maclise St on Wednesday 22 October at 1pm.
Then on Thursday 23 October there will be stories in Victory Park at 10.30am, outside the Market Building at 11.30am and at Maldon Rotunda at 2.45pm.

item.title: Dominique Portet: Marche Francais en Yarra Valley
item.description:
A dash of French flair will come to Victoria's Yarra Valley on November 30 when renowned winery Dominique Portet stage their very own Marche Francais.
Back for its second year, the Portet's open-air French Market will celebrate all things en français in the sprawling surrounds of the family's Yarra Valley winery. The Portet family belong to ten generations of wine-makers, and the French Market will be infused with a pedigree in joi de vivre that stretches all the way back to 18th Century France.
Market revelers can indulge in a specially curated collection of wares, tastes and treats from the Yarra Valley and beyond against the backdrop of the Portet's vineyards and cellar door. Enjoy hosted wine tastings and winery tours, sample the delicacies on offer including crepes, baguettes and brulees; handcrafted truffles, artisan breads, pastries, macarons, coffee and micro brews from neighbouring breweries - and oooh-la-la over the spécialités françaises for the home and garden.
Graze on baguettes, try your hand at petanque, sip on the Portet's famous Sparkling Rosé or simply take in the fresh air amongst the vines as a rolling line up of live music transports you to Provence.

image.altText: Dominique Portet: Marche Francais en Yarra Valley
Dominique Portet: Marche Francais en Yarra Valley

item.title: Substation Farmers' Market
item.description:
The Victorian Farmers Market Association accredited Substation Farmers' Market in Newport runs on the first and third Sundays of each month, offering a fantastic variety of fresh Victorian produce and a direct connection to local food producers.
The market features around 35 stallholders, offering a wide array of food from eggs, meat, fruit and vegetables to fresh pasta, cheese, wine, nuts and herbs, as well as plenty of things to eat and drink at the market.

item.title: Convicts Contribution to Goldfields Explored in Lecture at at Sovereign Hill
item.description:
The life of Tasmanian convicts who made their way to the goldfields will be explored this year as Sovereign Hill again holds its annual lecture about Ballarat's rich history in honour of Professor Weston Bates OAM.
Entitled 'Vandemonian Ballarat: a hidden history', the lecture by the University of Melbourne's Professor Janet McCalman, will look at the convicts who were sent to Van Diemen's land (now known as Tasmania) and how they found their way to the Ballarat goldfields.
Research has revealed that the convict presence in colonial Victoria was formidable. It's estimated that around 30,000 crossed Bass Strait in the late 1840s and made their way to the goldfields. Many survived their convict experience and went on to help build a new society. While much has been explored about them when they were in the convict system, little has been known about them once they were free.
Professor Janet McCalman, a Professor in History and Philosophy at the University of Melbourne, is exploring these stories in a project 'Founders and Survivors'. Aiming to record and study over 73,000 convicts transported to Tasmania, the project is uncovering some of the stories surrounding these Vandemonian gold miners, and examining the ways in which they sought to seek a new life for themselves and their families.
These stories will be shared in this annual lecture, which will include special theatrical entertainment, as well as light refreshments before the lecture.
Professor Weston Bates was an Australian historian specializing in the history of Ballarat and the goldfields, and each year, Sovereign Hill holds a lecture in his honour on a different subject relating to the goldfields.

image.altText: CONVICTS CONTRIBUTION TO GOLDFIELDS EXPLORED IN LECTURE AT SOVEREIGN HILL
CONVICTS CONTRIBUTION TO GOLDFIELDS EXPLORED IN LECTURE AT SOVEREIGN HILL

item.title: Children's Week- Bannockburn - Teddy Bears Picnic
item.description:

item.title: Sandringham Village Festival
item.description:
The Sandringham Village Festival has been running for over five years and each year gets bigger and better.
The streets in the Village area, bounded by Station, Melrose and Waltham Streets, are closed for the day. Sandringham traders will be open and there will be market stalls, food, and local community groups.
For the children there are four amusements including a jumping castle, swing chairs, giant slide and animal farm, a magician and an appearance by the star of children's literature, Andy Griffiths, who will be on the Melrose Street stage.
A great programme of live music is scheduled for our two stages from local performers as well as celtic folk band, Saoirse, Kings of Leisure, and popular cover band, Two Dogs.
St Kilda Football star Lenny Hayes will be signing his memoir, "Lenny: My Story" in Melrose Street.
For more information, please see website.

item.description:

item.title: The Philosophy Club presents Possible Futures
item.description:
Kids, get your thinking caps on and join The Library at the Dock as they explore big questions about the future!
The Philosophy Club brings you workshops about the future, for kids who always ask 'why?' and never settle for 'just because'. These small-group 'thinking' workshops will get kids pondering big questions that face humanity in the 21st century and beyond.
These workshops are led by professional facilitators of The Philosophy Club, experienced in helping children think collaboratively, engage with big questions and explore stimulating ideas.
There are two age-specific workshops:
- To Boldly Go Where No Child Has Gone Before for children ages 8 to 9 years: Space travel, interplanetary colonisation and extra-terrestrial intelligence are our springboards for exploring ethics in the far distant future. Experience an astronaut's launch into space with a dramatic simulation of lift-off, followed by a philosophical enquiry into why we might want to explore space. Explore real-life space capsules designed to reach out to extra-terrestrial civilisations, and even design and launch a space capsule of your own!
- When Things Start to Think for children ages 10 to 12 years: What does it mean to have a mind? Who or what has a mind? Does Wall-E think? What about a smartphone? A thermostat? Videos from cutting-edge robotics laboratories provide stimuli for an enquiry about artificial intelligence. How can we know whether a machine is really thinking or feeling? How can we know whether the person sitting beside us is really thinking or feeling?
These workshops are free, but bookings are essential. Please follow the link to our booking page to secure your child's place.
This event is part of Melbourne Knowledge Week.

item.title: GBEN Small Business Solutions Forum
item.description:

Hear from a small business owner, learn what government and other services are available to help you start and grow your business, ask questions, network, and get access to over 10 agencies in one place.

item.title: Alfa Romeo Club Spettacolo Concorso and Show and Shine
item.description:
The Alfa Romeo Owners Club (Vic Div) is holding its annual Spettacolo Concorso and Show 'n' Shine at a well known location at Wesley College, St Kilda Road campus.
On Sunday, Spettacolo is expected to have up to 300 Alfa Romeos on the field. This year's theme will be 60 years of the Giulietta sponsored by Essendon Alfa Romeo in addition to a 'Zagato Showcase' sponsored by Tiamo Restaurant and 10 years of the 932 GT sponsored by Berwick and Pakenham Alfa Romeo. item.description:

item.title: Benalla Festival
item.description:
As Spring and the warmer weather creep in, the Benalla community look forward to and welcome the Benalla Festival of fun and creativity.
The Benalla Festival has grown and evolved over the years to become an annual highlight on the city's events calendar and something people look forward to being a part of.
It provides an opportunity to connect with each other and appreciate the beautiful surrounds and spirit of country living.
The Benalla Festival Advisory Committee invites you to take the journey to celebrate this year's Benalla Festival theme Regional Harvest, celebrating the local producers.
The Benalla Festival Advisory Committee would like to thank its major partners, sponsors and Friends of the Festival. Their support enables the events to be free or low cost. As well as extending a big thank you to the community volunteers and the members of the Benalla Festival Advisory Committee, and school groups who have worked so hard to deliver the Festival.

item.title: Linden Postcard Show
item.description: The Linden Postcard Show is a unique open entry competition that sees hundreds of small format contemporary artworks adorn the gallery walls at Linden. With all artwork for sale, it's the ideal exhibition to discover an affordable treasure or the perfect gift.

item.title: The Human Connectome Project: Progress and Prospects
item.description:
The ICT for Life Sciences Forum is pleased to present an presentation by a leading brain researcher, Dr David van Essen of Washington University in St Louis. He is a key investigator in the Human Connectome Project (HCP) which is a project examining the brains circuitry, its variability and behaviour based on a population of 1,200 healthy adults.
The HCP is providing invaluable information about the healthy human brain and its variability. It will set the stage for characterising brain circuits during healthy development and in abnormal brain connectivity in many brain disorders and diseases.

image.altText: The Human Connectome Project: Progress and Prospects

item.title: Brunswick Kindergarten Fete
item.description:
Come celebrate Brunswick Kindergarten's 90th birthday at the Brunswick Kindergarten Fete.
Brunswick Kindergarten is a community-based Kindergarten which has been providing a stimulating learning program for three to five year olds since it opened its doors in 1924. They offer a dynamic learning program in a welcoming, nurturing and safe environment for all children to explore, grow, learn and express their individuality.
The Kindergarten community caters for over 170 families and offers a supportive, committed and active partnership between parents and staff to offer an educational service to the local community and beyond. The children come not just from Brunswick, but as far as Preston, Coburg and Carlton.
This year marks the Kinder's 90th birthday and to celebrate, their annual fete will be bigger and better than ever. There will be craft stalls, live entertainment, a silent auction, raffles, food stalls, and lots of fun activities for all ages.
The annual fete attracts over 1000 attendees and is the major fundraising event of the year that allows them to maintain the kindergarten and improve its facilities.
Fundraising is an essential and ongoing part of the organisation's activities. As they are only partially funded by the government, they need to constantly raise funds necessary for the running and general upkeep of the Kindergarten, including the purchase of new equipment, the professional development of staff and general maintenance of the building and grounds.
This year's fete will be held on Saturday 18 October, 10am to 4pm. Brunswick Kindergarten invites you to come along and support the Kindergarten's annual fete.

Children's week is celebrated annually and this year Hindmarsh Shire Council is proud to present Wiggi the Clown! Wiggi is a travelling performer based in St Kilda, Victoria.
Wiggi will perform in both Nhill and Jeparit for all children aged between 0-12.
Wiggi's performance in Jeparit will be from 9am-10am at the Jeparit Primary School.
Nhills performance will be held during playgroup on Friday October 24th 2014 from 1030am at the Nhill Kindergarten. Children are invited to dress up in a circus theme.
Hindmarsh Shire Council will also be hosting a colouring in competition throughout the Shire's four towns. One winner will be announced from each town, with exciting prizes to be won!

item.title: Spring Festival - Celebrating Whitehorse
item.description:
Spring Festival is a free, fun-filled day that celebrates the City of Whitehorse's vibrant community! Offering a perfect day out for all the family, this year's festival held on Sunday 19th October will celebrate the 20th anniversary of the City of Whitehorse.
Come and enjoy a huge variety free rides, performances, workshops and activity sessions - have your face painted, see and participate in the amazing Dreaming Space circus shows and workshops, play with the giant garden games and see the best local bands, singers and artists across five stages. Not all the action will happen on stage - festival goers will once again look to the sky to appreciate the aerial acrobatics of the Fly Factory.
Guests can also expect plenty of great food, delicious coffee and sweet treats, and there will be ample seating and grassed areas to kick back, relax and enjoy the festivities.
Most importantly, Spring Festival provides a great opportunity to get to know your local neighbourhood with the event showcasing displays by an abundance of local hobby clubs, interest groups and service providers, so come along and learn more about the activities offered just around the corner.

item.title: Snapperfest
item.description:
Celebrate the start of the fishing season in Port Albert over the Melbourne Cup Weekend as the town comes alive with music, food and free family entertainment for Snapperfest celebrations.
The activities start with a scary movie night on Friday at the Port Albert Hall. The first showing will commence at 5pm with movies getting scarier as the night goes on until its completion at midnight.
On Saturday, the hall will be transformed to host an underage disco aimed at the young and the young at heart. Everybody is welcome to come along to this Halloween themed event. Music will once again be provided by Mikes Mobile Music Mix.
Sunday is the Snapperfest Day. There will be a morning market at the Port Albert Hall, with free family entertainment in nearby Rutter Park food stall, hay bale maze, live music and plenty of room for everyone.
Local restaurants and cafes will be focusing on a seafood theme so everybody has a chance to enjoy some fresh local produce.

item.title: Children's Week Fun Ways To Play
item.description:
Manningham Community Health Services would like to invite you and your family to their exciting new workshop called Fun Ways To Play. Fun Ways To Play is a hands-on workshop that will give you lots of simple ideas to keep your baby, toddler or pre-schooler moving.
Their physiotherapist will share with you lots of tips and information including:
- The importance of physical activity for children - Fun games to play both indoors and outdoors - Simple ideas to include more active play in your child's every day lives
The popular Family Play Kits will also be available to purchase on the day. The Family Play Kits include simple games and activities for your child and family to play together.
Babies, toddlers and pre-schoolers are welcome and encouraged to join in on the game. As the workshop is hands-on we suggest that you wear comfortable clothing and shoes.
This workshop will be a fun and valuable experience for you and your kids!
Bookings are essential.

image.altText: Children's Week Fun Ways To Play
Children's Week Fun Ways To Play

item.title: Visible Music Sessions
item.description:
Multicultural Arts Victoria has joined force with the Melbourne Festival for the fourth year in a row presenting Igniting Imagination - a program that appoints culturally diverse Festival Ambassadors who are leaders in their artistic practice and communities, and for 2014, a series of free live music events featuring some of Melbourne's top emerging musicians who have been in Multicultural Arts Victoria's Visible Music Mentoring Program.
Multicultural Arts Victoria has programmed Visible Music Sessions in the Melbourne Festival every Sunday, free at the Foxtel Festival Hub that will feature some of the brightest stars from Multicultural Arts Victoria's Visible Music Mentoring Program.
Visible has kick-started the careers of emerging musicians from refugee, Indigenous and emerging backgrounds teaming them with leading musicians in this country, so these sessions will feature some of the most unusual and innovative creations the music industry has seen to date.
See website for full program details.
item.ns0:organiser: Multicultural Arts Victoria and The Melbourne Festival

item.title: Strawberry Affair: A Match Made In Heaven!
item.description:
The Yarra Valley's new strawberry season will get off to a delicious start by celebrating one of the most loved culinary combinations - strawberries and chocolate at the Yarra Valley Chocolaterie & Ice Creamery.
Strawberry Affair will see the European Chocolatiers transform the bounty of new season strawberries into a showcase of limited edition, decadent couverture chocolate and strawberry combinations.
Indulge your desire for this match made in heaven with chocolate dipped strawberries in your choice of white, milk or dark couverture, handcrafted strawberry truffles; a changing array of fresh cakes, tarts, torts and pastries inspired by new season strawberries and chocolate; giant scoops of their house made strawberry ice cream, freshly baked scones with the best strawberry jam, strawberry sundaes or strawberry milkshakes.
Tempted? Make a date to visit them for a Strawberry Affair.

The family friendly event will include activities that support renewing everyday items, educational games on what and how to recycle and interactive workshops on how to reuse items from around the home.

There will be a Cool 4 Kids Music Man concert, instrument making workshops, Jamie and Kim's mobile petting zoo, story time with Wimmera Regional Library Corporation, health professionals with health information for families and Playgroup Victoria's Play Van activities.
This event will be held at the Birchip Community Leisure Centre in Birchip, the expo is a free event with the first acts commencing at 10.30am. This is a free event.

item.title: Dementia: Understanding to Action - Melbourne
item.description:
Alzheimer's Australia Vic is on the road with Dementia: Understanding to Action, an information-packed community event covering three sessions on:
An understanding of dementia: learn what dementia is, its main causes, key signs and symptoms, the relationship between brain and behaviour and identify main risk factors.
Your brain matters: research shows that living a brain healthy life, a person's risk of developing dementia may be reduced. Learn the five simple steps to maximise your brain health.
From diagnosis to support: what you can do if concerned that someone you know has signs of dementia, how to seek an assessment and what support is available in your area. Counsellors will be on-site to answer questions.
Proudly sponsored by Exxon Mobil.
Timings: 10:00am - 10:15am Registration and refreshment, 10:15am - 11:15am An Understanding of Dementia: 11:15am - 11:35am Morning tea 11:35am - 12:25pm Your Brain Matters 12:25pm - 13:15pm From diagnosis to support
For more information please visit the website.

item.title: Dementia: Understanding to Action - Sale
item.description:
Alzheimer's Australia Vic is on the road with Dementia: Understanding to Action, an information-packed community event covering three sessions on:
An understanding of dementia: learn what dementia is, its main causes, key signs and symptoms, the relationship between brain and behaviour and identify main risk factors.
Your brain matters: research shows that living a brain healthy life, a person's risk of developing dementia may be reduced. Learn the five simple steps to maximise your brain health.
From diagnosis to support: what you can do if concerned that someone you know has signs of dementia, how to seek an assessment and what support is available in your area. Counsellors will be on-site to answer questions.
Timings: 10:00am - 10:15am Registration and refreshment 10:15am - 11:15am An Understanding of Dementia 11:15am - 11:35am Morning tea 11:35am - 12:25pm Your Brain Matters 12:25pm - 13:15pm From diagnosis to support
For more information please visit the website.
Proudly sponsored by: Exxon Mobil

item.title: Bass Coast Children's Expo
item.description:

Children's Week is a national program recognising the talents, skills, achievements and rights of young people. It is based on the articles expressed in the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child, highlighting play, wellbeing and protection.

item.title: Freshwater Creek Steiner School Spring Fair & Open Day
item.description:
The Spring Fair is the highlight of the year at the Freshwater Creek Steiner School, just half an hour from Geelong in a bush setting.
It is a celebration for school families who invite neighbours and visitors to join them and take in the atmosphere of their beautiful school.
Parents and children bake cakes to enjoy at Chai Cafe, along with homemade savoury food and the good old fashioned sausage sizzle - with sausages made from biodynamically raised meat. Homemade lemonade, jams and preserves will be available for purchase, along with organically grown produce.
The school's craft co-op stall offers goods made by hand with natural materials, displaying the talent of the school community. This stall will also sell second-hand Steiner toys. A vibrant marketplace will showcase quality, handmade, natural and sustainable goods.
Acoustic music from children, local musicians and buskers will provide a melodious backdrop as visitors browse the stalls, or sit to rest and refresh themselves.
In the free games area, children will be able to dig for gnomes' gold, fish for brightly coloured fish, and play a range of games to suit all ages.
Education and excitement go hand in hand: a display of young native animals; the Viking tents of the Dubh-Linn branch of The New Varangian Guard (aka The Vikings in Geelong); building a birdhouse with the Geelong East Men's Shed; and the Freshwater Creek CFA and their truck.
The fair is on Saturday, 25 October, and starts at 10am.

item.title: Darcy Fox EP Launch
item.description:
Delightful country/ pop singer-songwriter Darcy Fox is pleased to announce the launch of her EP My Own Happy Ending. Darcy will play an all ages show at The Push Pop Up Shop in Northcote as part of The Darebin Music Feast on Sunday 19th October.
My Own Happy Ending is a collection of songs Darcy wrote over the past year covering the angrier and upsetting side of relationships. The loops and layers weave through an acoustic pop sound and a full drum kit has been replaced with a cajon box drum, giving the EP a beautifully unique sound.
Earlier this year, Darcy became the first ever solo artist to take out the coveted top prize in the FReeZA Push Start Battle of the Bands competition held at Moomba, trumping over 350 other acts.
The Push Pop Up Stage Show is bound to be a treat with Darcy excited to share her new stories with an audience on the busy High Street in Northcote. With her sweet vocals and quick wit, Darcy promises to deliver a captivating and fun performance.
Darcy plays The Push Pop up Shop at Darebin Music Feast on Sunday 19th October at 3:00PM Free Entry, All Ages

ns0:venue.name: Music Feast - The Push Pop-Up Shop

item.title: Kilmore Men's Shed Open Day
item.description:
Kilmore Men's Shed is hosting an open day.
Exhibitions will include a display on wood turning, a vintage car show and woodwork created by the Shed members
Selected items will be for sale, and if you get hungry there will be a sausage sizzle!
Starting at 10.30pm to 2.30pm at the Tramway Museum.

item.title: Southgate Cinema
item.description:
A new film program heralds the on-set of spring from September to November at Southgate Cinema, Melbourne's only silent cinema. A new season of the long-running and free Tuesday movie nights will be programmed until May 2015.
Already an attractive anomaly as a free deckchair cinema, Southgate Cinema now offers a unique 'Blue Class' experience with a movie menu delivered to your deckchair from next-door eatery Bluetrain, recently refurbished with a critically acclaimed new design.
Southgate cinephiles can devour gourmet pizzas and graze on an eclectic variety of tasting platters with selections including a Bollywood platter, soft shell taco platter and Chinese five spice chicken ribs as they sit back and watch films like The Book Thief, Tracks and The Hunger Games 2: Catching Fire, with headphones and audio kits.
In November, Southgate Cinema films celebrate the theme of freedom with Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom, 12 Years a Slave and Inside Llewlyn Davis programed along with acclaimed but selectively screened Australian film Around the Block, about an Aboriginal boy in Redfern torn between his unexpected love of acting and the disintegration of his family.
Celebrated by audiences and critics alike, Southgate Cinema is listed on Time Out Melbourne's Bucket List and as a Herald Sun Hidden Gem.
The full September-November Southgate Cinema program and Blue Class menu can be viewed online.
Surrounding the cinema is Southgate's diverse range of restaurants and bars, including newly opened Italian restaurant and wine bar ARTUSI, Bavarian bier hall Hophaus and Inuit and native North American inspired restaurant Amarok. A range of boutique retailers including vintage and fair trade fashion, designer homewares, art deco jewellery and antique art can also be found within the precinct.
This is a free event but bookings are required.

item.title: Illuminating Bowel Cancer
item.description:
Is bowel cancer prevention on the horizon? Come down for a free bowel cancer public forum at Walter and Eliza Hall Institute.
Bowel cancer is the second biggest cause of cancer-related deaths in Australia. Ninety per cent of bowel cancers can be treated successfully if found early, however fewer than 40 per cent of cases are diagnosed in time.
At this free public forum, clinicians and scientists will discuss the latest in bowel cancer research, including early detection methods and future outlooks for preventive treatment. Ask the expert panel your questions during the extended Q&A.
Register online.
Speakers: Professor Tony Burgess and Dr Jeanne Tie.
Time: 6pm to 7pm.

ns0:venue.name: Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research

item.ns0:organiser: Walter and Eliza Hall Institute of Medical Research

item.description: Sugar Art by David Lyons - is a photo of sugar being added to a cup of tea really art? What role does subject have in making photography art? How do we determine 'what is art?'

Families can walk, run, ride, scooter or take a pram, and there is the option of two starting points (five kilometres - Botanic Gardens and one and a half kilometres - Lake Weeroona), and answer quiz questions along the way with the opportunity to win prizes!
At the conclusion of the walk, a celebration event will be held in the Hargreaves Mall comprising of stage entertainment The Mudcakes, an animal farm, face painting, portable golf driving range, helium balloons, paper sculpture activities and much more.

item.title: Wallan Relay for Life
item.description:

The event itself is organised by a dedicated team of community volunteers and encourages teams of 10-15 people to get together, fundraise and then participate in a relay-style walk or run, challenging them to stay on the track overnight!
You can stay for the whole event and camp out, enjoy a heap of fun activities and attend moving ceremonies which make the event so very special.
The town of Wallan is hosting on Saturday November 22nd commencing at 4pm and ending at 10am on Sunday 23rd of November on the second oval at Greenhills Reserve, Wallan.
If you would like to participate please register now!
We are always looking for volunteers and sponsors as well in any way, shape or form!

item.title: Remembering Black Saturday five years on
item.description:
The bushfires that ravaged Victoria on 7 February 2009 claimed the lives of 173 people and destroyed more than 2000 homes.
Five years on, Melbourne curator Liza Dale-Hallett and historian Robert Kenny reflect on Black Saturday and how the devastating event continues to shape their personal and professional lives at the State Library of Victoria.
Robert Kenny lost his home on that tragic day. When writing about his experiences in his 2013 book, Gardens of fire: an investigative memoir (UWAP), he wove his own story into a broader history of the relationship between settler Australians and fire.
Working closely with communities in the wake of the Black Saturday bushfires, Liza Dale-Hallett has led the development of the Victorian Bushfires Collection at Museum Victoria.
In this discussion, Liza and Robert consider the role of history and memory in the way we make sense of such traumatic events, and the role historians are playing in the recovery phase.

item.title: Coming Home: a social history exhibition
item.description:
Coming Home is a social history exhibition exploring the history of Bundoora Homestead as a Repatriation Mental Hospital for returned servicemen from 1920 until 1993. This free exhibition runs from 3 October to 7 December 2014.
Coming Home tells a story of state and national significance, and reveals elements of a little known chapter in the care and management of veterans suffering from mental disorders as a result of their war service.
Historical photographs from the National Archives of Australia, Australian War Memorial, Red Cross and City of Darebin Art and History Collection will be on display. Also included are artefacts, artworks and personal stories from a wide variety of private and public collections.

image.altText: 04_Dr John Cade at his Desk_Royal Park Mental Hospital_1970

item.title: Oral history in the digital age
item.description:
Life stories surround everyone in this digital age. But what are the challenges and opportunities in creating, interpreting and producing digital oral histories today?
In this Making Public Histories seminar, US historian Professor Michael Frisch, one of the most influential contributors to international developments in oral and public history, explores this timely topic in depth.
In the 1970s, Professor Frisch led new interpretations of memory and history. In the 1980s, he coined the notion of 'shared authority' to illuminate the oral history relationship. Since the 1990s, he has worked at the cutting edge of digital technologies for creating, sharing and interpreting recorded interviews.
In this public lecture, Professor Frisch will use a social history of 20th-century Australian lives and memories, the Australian Generations Oral History Project, as one example to explore the transformation of oral history in our digital age.

item.title: Cranbourne GP Run 2014
item.description:
The roar of motorcycles and a sea of colour and chrome will fill the streets of Cranbourne on Saturday 18 October at the Cranbourne GP Run. The City of Casey is proud to host one of the largest and most exciting events in Victoria, as thousands of motorcyclists gather in Cranbourne to travel en-masse to Phillip Island for the 2014 Australian Motorcycle Grand Prix.
The City of Casey is excited to announce that the Mirabel Foundation has been named as the charity partner for the 2014 Cranbourne GP Run and Shane Jacobson has been selected to wave the flag at the 2014 event.
Shane is one of Australia's most loved award-winning actors, presenters and entertainers, having worked in radio, television, film and theatre. His silver screen credits include Hollywood blockbuster The Bourne Legacy.
Shane's love of acting is only matched by his passion for motor sport, and these two worlds collided when Shane co-hosted Top Gear Australia in 2010 and 2011. He is currently co-hosting Top Gear Festival with UK hosts Jeremy Clarkson, James May Steve Pizatti and Australian racing legend Craig Lowndes.
From 8.15 am on the day, there will be plenty of entertainment to keep the whole family enthralled with a variety of children's activities, food stalls and entertainment including Captain America, Scratch Art, Origami and Face Painting. At 10.00 am, the pace picks up for the highlight of the day when Shane Jacobson will wave-off thousands of gathered motorcyclists on their journey.

item.title: Children's Week Event for South Gippsland Playgroups
item.description:
Playgroups and parent groups from Nyora to Welshpool, from Mirboo North to Venus Bay, are invited to come along to the basketball stadium at South Gippsland SPLASH for a morning of fun to celebrate National Children's Week. The event runs from 10am to 12noon on Monday 20th October 2014. Entry and all activities are free.
The theme of Children's Week 2014 is Celebrating Children's right to speak and be heard, which is Article 12 from United Nations Convention of the Rights of the Child.
To celebrate the idea that children need to talk and be listened to, they will have a variety of interactive play activities in which parents, carers and their children can get involved. Bring your child along and share a story, chat over the playdough, help them balance on a beam, sing and play under the parachute and add your child's picture to the Celebrating Children's Art Gallery.
All community playgroups and parent groups in South Gippsland are invited to attend, as is anyone who is wishing to join a playgroup.

image.altText: Children's Week Event for South Gippsland Playgroups

item.title: Clyde Park 2015 Golden Plains Arts Trail
item.description:
The Clyde Park 2015 Golden Plains Arts Trail is a weekend adventure showcasing the work of artists of the Golden Plains region.
Visit usually private studios and other creative spaces to meet the artists and see exhibitions, demonstrations and workshops while exploring the towns, back lanes and diverse landscape of the Golden Plains. Check out performances and regional wine and food along the Trail.
The Golden Plains is close to Melbourne, Geelong and Ballarat.

item.title: Wade Marynowsky: Nostalgia for Obsolete Futures
item.description:
NGV Studio hosts an extraordinary exhibition called Nostalgia for Obsolete Futures where visitors are greeted by a group of bizarre interactive human-like robots let loose in the foyer of NGV Australia.
Dr Wade Marynowsky is an anti-disciplinary artist who works across robotics, immersive and interactive installation, performance, music and video. His practice typically draws on technology and programmed structures to create works that straddle humour, high-camp and a host of unnerving thematic orientations to absorbing effect.
Nostalgia for Obsolete Futures gives an insight into Marynowsky's remarkable artistic practice. It includes interactive robotics, sound sculpture, audiovisual installations and performances. It also reveals a surprising and dramatic new work that Marynowsky is developing at NGV Studio during the course of the exhibition.

image.altText: Wade Marynowsky: Nostalgia for Obsolete Futures
Wade Marynowsky: Nostalgia for Obsolete Futures

item.title: Superfictions 2: As If
item.description:
'As If', curated by Dr Peter Hill and Adeline Kueh, brings together eleven international and Australian artists whose work explores fictive narratives through painting, sculpture, video and installation. The world of Superfictions explores mythical creatures, fake businesses, strange muses, dystopian futures, Love Hotels and telepathic post-human conditions.
The works range from Turner Prize finalist Nathan Coley's collaboration with Cate Blanchett – a meditation on the laneways and dark alleys of Melbourne and Glasgow – to Melbourne painter Grant Hill's images of suburbia that look 'as if' they are something else.
Several contemporary artists have, in recent years, investigated the animal and plant kingdoms, but few so poetically as the Singapore-based Institute of Critical Zoologists, represented in the exhibition by a complex artists book. This is a celebration of the strange forking paths that confront imaginations in the garden of Superfictions.
This event is supported by the City of Melbourne Arts Grants program.
Source: City of Melbourne What's On

item.title: Nomad - Float
item.description:
Nomad is a collaboration by Michele Donegan and Ara Dolatian, who install coloured woollen webs in galleries and public spaces. The work responds to the particular site, considering architecture and purpose, and the web reinvents each site by creating a sense of other-worldliness, transforming the nature of the space.
The work forms a 'shelter' that is reminiscent of nomads stopping and establishing a safe place for a period of time. The web is accessible to a wide public audience to explore, enjoy and be immersed in - and maybe even involved in during the installation period.
All welcome to come and view or participate in Nomad's installation process from 23rd September.

item.title: Halloween Spooky Storytime at East Melbourne Library
item.description:
It's time for fearless families to bring their little ghouls and boos to celebrate Spooky Storytime!
Celebrate with jokes, stories, music and party games. Wear your best costume and have a scream during storytime. There will be face painting, dress-ups and loads of scary activities to do. Plus special guest Wizard Silvernose.
Cautionary note, there will be nuts and colourants in food items. Suits ages three to six years.

item.title: Children of the Night at East Melbourne Library
item.description:
Come and celebrate Spook Night at East Melbourne Library, with devilish host Mr Lou Cyfer.
Show your ticket to the Ferry Man and bring out your inner demon with face painting. Win prizes for best joke, costume and story, and feast away the evening.
For your trick and treat, prepare your dance moves to Monster Mash, Ghost Busters or Time Warp, and get ready to hit the dance floor.
Please note that nuts and colourants will be in food items served.
This event suits children aged seven and over and their keepers.

item.title: Angliss Family Fun Day -Childrens Week
item.description:
Angliss Children's Centre in Footscray is turning 25 years old and celebrating Children's week 2014 with a Family Fun Day and Open Day full of fun activities and interactive workshops for pre-school children and their families.
Learn drumming, circus tricks, twirl hoola-hoops, decorate cup-cakes, make rice paper rolls, paint plant pots and more.
Held at Angliss Children's Centre the Family Fun Day is accessible by public transport or car and will be open between 10 am and 3 pm.
Children's activities and workshops are free.

item.title: Children's Week at the Goldfields Childen's Centre
item.description:
This is an event for the children who attend the Centre to come along and enjoy the festivities of Children's Week, especially a visiting animal farm.
The children will have the opportunity of interacting with the animals, feeding and grooming them. Along with the animal farm other activities that the children will be able to partake in include a pyjama day, disco day, teddy bears picnic and many other activities.
Please note, this event is only for the children who attend the Children's Centre.

item.title: Play 2 Learn: B Theme day
item.description:
Play 2 Learn Supported Playgroup at Good Beginnings are having a special B theme day to celebrate children's week. Everybody is welcome from 10am to 12pm.
Come for B stories, B games, making B things, B fruit (berries and bananas) and a shared lunch (please bring a sandwich). Come and Be involved and Be heard!
Sponsorship from the Department of Education and Early Childhood Development has enabled this event to happen.

item.title: Inverloch parkrun
item.description:
Inverloch parkrun is a free weekly timed five kilometre event for runners and walkers of all ages and abilities, which takes place every Saturday at 8 am, with a pre-run briefing at 7:45 am.
If you haven't been to a parkrun before, register online and print off your unique barcode to bring along with you to each parkrun event you attend. With your barcode in hand you will be able to record your time and see your results posted on their website.

item.title: Children's Week - Biodiversity of the Western Volcanic Plains
item.description: During Children's Week, Ecolinc will be featuring the Biodiversity of the Western Volcanic Plains. Students attending Ecolinc during Children's Week will be exploring the plants and animals of the Western Volcanic Plains using Ecolinc's new Flora and Fauna Field Guide app and a range of online outreach programs including Quadrats Online, Grassland Food Webs, Managing Grassland Ecosystems, Talk with the Experts, Virtual Tour to Mt Rothwell and an Interactive Quiz.

item.title: Kingston Toy Library Children's Week Family Fun Day
item.description:
Kingston Toy Library Children's Week Family Fun Day is a free community fun day for all families across the municipality to celebrate children, families and having fun.
The event will feature an animal farm, sporting activities, face-painting, and many of the Toy Library toys, a jumping castle, baby-play activities, play dough and sand activities and much more. With food and drink available this will be a great family day out.
Held at the Peter Scullin Reserve also known as the Pirate Ship playground from 9.30 to 2pm, there is plenty of parking and only a five min walk with pram from the Mordialloc train station.

item.title: Toyed and True - An exhibition of handmade toys
item.description:
Toyed and True at the East Gippsland Art Gallery is about handmade toys - the things children used to play with before the invention of the manufactured toy. Many toys are re-discovered by new generations and today there is increasing interest in traditional, handmade toys.
From pebbles, sticks, rags, knucklebones, seed cones and straw have come puppets, kites, pull-alongs, dolls, hobby horses, blocks, bows and arrows, billy carts, terracotta animals, corn dollies, whistles, skipping ropes and tops just to name a few.

item.title: Petanque Triples Tournament
item.description:
Held in High street Avoca over the weekend, the Pyrenees Petanque Triples Tournament is one of Central Victoria's premium petanque competitions.
Fully sanctioned by the Petanque Federation of Australia, the event is open to all licensed members of PFA affiliated clubs.
If you have never played Petanque but are curious about this International game, come along and check out the action. You will have the opportunity to meet players from local and interstate clubs over the lunch break and the chance to arrange a 'try out' on a club day if you would like to.
The Pyrenees Petanque Club promotes Petanque as a family friendly, low impact sport open to players of all ages and abilities. Club members enjoy sharing the tactics, strategies and techniques of the game and encourage newcomers to improve their skills and enjoy the benefits of club membership.

item.title: Mitchell Shire Pet Expo
item.description:
On Saturday 15th November Mitchell Shire Council will be holding its annual Pet Expo from 10am - 3pm.
The Pet Expo aims to promote Responsible Pet Ownership to residents of Mitchell Shire.
A variety of displays, demonstrations and activities are offered. Pet businesses, clubs and organisations are encouraged to attend to showcase their products and services.
The Pet Expo is held at Hadfield Park Wallan from 10am to 3pm.
Free entertainment is provided for Children including a petting zoo, jumping castle, face painter and balloon artist. Adults and children alike will enjoy displays of flyball and agility dogs. Try your dog out in the free lure course activity or participate in a puppy pre-school class. If you enter one of our competitions with your pet you could win a prize.
Discounted pet micro chipping will be available as well as reduced price Council Animal Registration.
If you are thinking of getting a pet in the future you will find information on a range of different pets and their welfare requirements.
To book a stall visit their website or for more information contact the Community Compliance Team on (03) 57346200.

item.title: Westvale Playgroup Open Day
item.description:
Westvale Playgroup is having an open day for people to come and try the playgroup and experience the benefits of the playgroup. Playgroup is for children zero to five years old.
Visitors can share in a fun morning of pirate themed activities including making a pirate kit complete with a telescope, pirate hat, eye patch, build your own mini pirate boat, tattoos, face painting and more.

item.title: Children's Week at Doncaster Library
item.description: Manningham City Council and Whitehorse Manningham Libraries present Tony Bones Entertainment, in a children's theatre performance of 'The Windy Farm', a book shortlisted for Children's Book of the Year. Join them at the beautiful new Doncaster Library for Children's Week in the excited redevelopment at Manningham City Square, close to Westfield Doncaster.
item.ns0:organiser: WhitehorseManninham Regional LIbrary Manninham City Council

item.title: Whitehorse Spring Festival
item.description:
The Whitehorse Spring Festival is a free, fun-filled day that celebrates a vibrant community! The perfect day out for all the family, this year's festival will celebrate the 20th anniversary of the City of Whitehorse.
Come and enjoy a huge variety free rides, performances, workshops and activities. Have your face painted, see and participate in the amazing Dreaming Space circus shows and workshops, play with the giant garden games and see the best local bands, singers and artists.
Not all the action will happen on stage - festival goers will once again look to the sky to appreciate the aerial acrobatics of the Fly Factory. Guests can also expect plenty of great food, delicious coffee and sweet treats.
Most importantly, Spring Festival provides a great opportunity to get to know your local neighbourhood with the event showcasing displays by an abundance of local hobby clubs, interest groups and service providers.

item.title: Regenerate 2014 Festival
item.description:
Mitchell Shire Council invites residents to save the date and join the 'Regenerate 2014' community celebration in Hadfield Park in Wallan.
Fun on the days includes Emergency Services displays, live music, food and wine vendors, rides and activities.
Performers include: • Reece Mastin - winner of the X Factor 2011 and renowned for his #1 hit single "Good Night" • Tim Campbell - star of Home and Away and House Husbands will perform classic songs from his ARIA top 30 album "High School Disco". • Chocolate Starfish - One of Australia's favourite ARIA winning bands continues to rock the hits!
Time: 1pm-5pm - Free entry, all ages welcome!
For updates visit www.facebook.com/MitchellShire
Proudly supported by: • Regional Development Victoria • Bendigo Bank • Department of Human Services • Barry Plant • Kapish • Maddocks • Metropolitan Planning Authority • Metro Property Development • Preferred Training Networks • Roegen • sweett • Justitia • Hogens Hotel • Channel Nine
Acknowledging the strength of the community and our local emergency service providers.

item.description:

Time: 11am to 3pm Price: Free
For more information on the Wedding Open Day an other events at Peppers The Sands Resort Torquay, please refer to their websit.e

item.title: Mitchell Shire Garage Sale Trail Day
item.description:
It's garage sales on the one big day right across Australia and the Mitchell Shire Council!
Garage Sale Trail is about re-using great stuff, reducing waste to landfill, meeting the neighbours, stimulating local economies, and providing an awesome platform for fundraising, all with the support of participating local councils.
See website for more information.

image.altText: Mitchell Shire Garage Sale Trail day
Mitchell Shire Garage Sale Trail day

item.title: The Absolutely Fabulous Fresh Food Festival Daylesford
item.description:
The Absolutely Fabulous Fresh Food Festival (TAFFFF) Daylesford, an initiative of Hepburn Health Service, aims to promote healthy eating and use of fresh produce.
If the idea of a free lunch, renowned local chef's cooking demonstrations, loads of fresh food tastings, health checks, local kids art exhibitions, information on worm farming, growing your own food, door prizes and loads of fun appeals to you then make sure you come along.
There will be something for all ages including activities and face painting for pre schoolers and after school healthy snacks for primary and secondary students.
The Daylesford TAFFFF will be held on Thursday 16th October at Daylesford Town Hall between 12 midday and 5pm.

image.altText: The Absolutely Fabulous Fresh Food Festival (TAFFFF) Daylesford
The Absolutely Fabulous Fresh Food Festival (TAFFFF) Daylesford

item.title: Story Time on Saturdays
item.description:
Story time will be starting on Saturdays at the Wallan Library at 11am.
Introduce your child to the joys of rhymes, reading and the wonderful world of books with Mitchell Library Service’s free sessions. These sessions provide opportunities to meet with other parents and carers and social interaction with other children. They also help your child to develop language skills. They can be a special time to share with your child and are great fun!
No bookings are required. Come listen to stories and songs on a Saturday!
The session is aimed at toddlers, pre-school and kids up to grade prep/one.

ns0:venue.name: Wallan Library and Customer Service Centre

item.title: Studio Artists Show @ Old Post Office Seymour
item.description:
The Old Post Office Seymour is holding an exhibition of work by a group of Studio Artists. These professional artists have studios they open at specific times of the year, holding classes, demonstrate and judge in their field of expertise.
Exhibiting artists will include Ross Paterson, Agnes Szetey, Richard Chamerski, Kate Jenvey, Brett Jarrett and many others.
Studio artists working in other mediums include art glass worker Marina Villani of Myriad Glass Kilmore. Other well-known studio artists are the Beechworth Potters.
So many of the artists have studios, that it's impossible to see them all, displaying the art together gives the visitor one place to see whose work they like and to compare the diverse styles.
Over the sixteen days in November the Fine Art Gallery will be open every day and the many roses in the garden will also be in full bloom.

ns0:venue.name: Old Post Office Seymour, Fine Art Gallery & Licensed Restaurant

item.title: Seymour Disability Expo
item.description:
Over the next few years, as the National Disability Insurance Scheme becomes a reality, almost 5,000 Seymour and Lower Hume region residents with disabilities will gain greater control over their lives and the services they choose.
The upcoming FamilyCare Seymour Disability Expo offers a crucial opportunity for people with a disability, and those who are aged, their families, carers, supporters, friends, health professionals and the wider community to come and look at the services that are available to the region; including aids, technology, vehicles, equipment, support services, health and wellbeing.
The Expo is an opportunity to seek information and advice on disability services offered in the region by over 30 different service providers.
There's something for everyone at the Expo: • Specialist service providers • Q and A with government agencies • Respite Programs • Latest products, equipment & aids • Accessible sporting activities and displays • Discover better health and wellbeing • Children's Services • Employment Services • Learn more about advocacy • Resource ideas for home modifications • Carer's services • Games and Activities • Arts and Crafts

item.title: Disability Support Expo
item.description:
Over the next few years, as the National Disability Insurance Scheme becomes a reality, almost 5,000 Seymour and Lower Hume region residents with disabilities will gain greater control over their lives and the services they choose.
The upcoming FamilyCare Seymour Disability Expo offers a crucial opportunity for people with a disability, and those who are aged, their families, carers, supporters, friends, health professionals and the wider community to come and look at the services that are available to the region; including aids, technology, vehicles, equipment, support services, health and wellbeing.
The expo is an opportunity to seek information and advice on disability services offered in the region by over 30 different service providers.
See website for more information.

item.title: Frozen - Family Movie Night
item.description:
Come celebrate Children's Week with a Family Movie Night. Come ready in your PJ's to enjoy a screening of the popular Disney movie Frozen.
Movie will begin at 6pm. Don't forget to bring your pillows and blankets to get comfy. Enjoy a barbecue before the movie from 4-6pm, while having your face painted, be entertained by a balloon artist and find out about local information and services for children and families and of course there will be popcorn!!

address.address1: Cnr of Mollison and Pinniger St

item.title: St Patrick's Primary School Car Boot Market
item.description:
Got things to sell? Back by popular demand is the St Patrick's Primary School Car Boot Market! All sorts of treasures will be available.
Thursday 18 October, 8am till 2pm (Stall holders set up at 6.30am) Single Spot - $15, Double - $28, BYO power
Bookings Contact Tracey 0418 649 994 or http://www.trybooking.com/fnjc

image.altText: St Patrick's Primary School Car Boot Market
St Patrick's Primary School Car Boot Market

item.title: Wellington Shire Children's Week Roadshow
item.description:
Wellington Children's Week 2014 will be focusing on more localities across the Wellington Shire through hosting a Children's Week Activity at various townships throughout the week.
This ensures that vulnerable children whose families may not have access to transport can still take part in the Children's Week celebrations.
UnitingCare Gippsland are working in partnership with the Wellington Shire Council. The theme for the activities will be 'Messy Play' and there will be many activities from mud, slime and worms!!

ns0:venue.name: Various Venues Across the Wellington Shire

item.title: Have a ball - tennis fun for kids
item.description:
As part of the Geelong Children's Week activities, Centre Court Indoor Tennis is offering a fun, interactive tennis based activity for pre-schoolers.
The Have a Ball session is perfect for small hands and active bodies. Racquets, kids afternoon tea provided.
This is a free event but bookings are essential.
Please arrive 10 minutes early.
To book call 5272 1760 or email details and contact number to info@geelongindoortennis.com.au

item.title: Belgrave South Community Market
item.description:
Held at the Community Hall, the Belgrave South Community Market has become a highlight in town since first opening.
On the first Sunday of each month, the market delivers a unique array of local handmade arts, crafts, designs, food and kids entertainment. It isn't just a market, but a place to gather, meet and greet, network and be inspired.
Save the date and help the market celebrate its first birthday. Be surprised with the range of kid's activities and entertainment including the sound of African drumming, jumping castle, magic and a lot more!
Bring the whole family and after you've finished at the market, take a scenic drive to Mt. Dandenong ranges for more beautiful views and nature appreciation.

item.title: Children's Week: The Ian Potter Foundation Children's Garden 10th Birthday
item.description:
Join the fun as the Royal Botanic Gardens celebrate the 10th birthday and re-opening of the beloved Ian Potter Foundation Children's Garden.
Explore the new Gathering Lawn and Desert Island and participate in free children's activities.
Time: 11am - 3pm
For more information call the Royal Botanic Gardens Visitor Centre on 03 9252 2300.

ns0:venue.name: The Ian Potter Foundation Children's Garden

image.altText: Children's Week: The Ian Potter Foundation Children's Garden 10th Birthday

item.title: Remembering Georges
item.description:
The Georges department store in Melbourne still holds a special place in the hearts and minds of Melburnians and Australians. It ran from 1880 through to the early 90s and was renowned the world over for its quality of merchandise and excellence in customer service.
The two George brothers who founded the store had, as their motto, 'what we do, we do well' and indeed they did as so many people to this day want to share their memories of Georges.
The book is a lavish production and includes interviews with fifty former Georges employees. The launch will definitely be a night to remember.

item.title: Melbourne Music at Spring Fling Street Festival
item.description:
The Spring Fling Street Festival is a premier community event celebrating everything North and West Melbourne.
Club Voltaire will be hosting a local music show featuring some of Melbourne's finest musicians, including Ashley Carmody, The Girl Friday Public Domain Project, Karl Huttenmeister, Cornfed Creature, Greg Steps, Straythread, Little Theatre, Anna Cordell, The Rambling Roots and Amber Isles.

item.title: Connected Art Exhibition
item.description:
More than 150 new and emerging artists with a disability or experience of mental illness will showcase their work in the 12th State Trustees Connected Art Exhibition.
Curated by Andrew Chew from No Vacancy Gallery, Connected features artists selected from 600 entries across Victoria. The works display a range of artistic styles and mediums to showcase the diversity of artistic expression that can be explored through the lens of disability and mental illness.
State Trustees Connected Art Exhibition is sponsored by Maurice Blackburn, Ern Jensen Funerals, Thomson Real Estate, Noel Jones Real Estate and Nous Group.

item.title: Wandin Park Horse Trials
item.description:
The Wandin Park Horse Trials is on again in 2015! This year Wandin Park will be holding the Australian National Championships and this will bring all the top eventers from all over Australia.
With lots of shopping and entertainment over the whole weekend, bring a picnic or eat at the many catering options available.
A great weekend out for the whole family and it is free! Wandin Park is only an hour east of the Melbourne City in the heart of the Yarra Valley.

item.title: First View by Guy Morgan
item.description:
As the winner of the Cambridge Studio Gallery's Portrait Prize, Who is Looking at You, Guy Morgan's award is a solo exhibition, which will be his first in Melbourne.
Trained at St Martins School of Art and the London College of Painting, then completing a Masters of Studio Arts at Sydney College of Arts, Guy Morgan resumed painting after a 30-year career in advertising.
In the last 12 years, Morgan has developed a signature style that uses eye-droppers and highly liquid oil paint to create large, textured works. These can be best seen in his Nebula series (some of which will be shown in Melbourne).
Recently Morgan turned to portraiture to investigate the effects of distorted vision after suffering a detached retina in late 2011. Interesting and unconventional, the portrait series After Retinal Detachment has had great success, with works being hung in the Archibald 2013, the Mosman Prize 2012 & 2013, and the 2014 Percival Portrait Prize and 2014 Black Swan Prize for Portraiture. He was a double semi-finalist in the 2013 Moran Portrait Prize and shortlisted in the International Emerging Artist Award 2013.
First View is an opportunity for the Melbourne audience to see a selection of Guy Morgan's Portraits, Landscapes, Abstracts and Nebula Series. The diversity in his work brings many surprises but most impressive is the technique and its effect that can only be truly appreciated in the flesh - it's the best reason to come and see the show!
Linda Fleet, Deputy Director, Arts Victoria, Strategic Marketing & Communications will officially open the exhibition.

item.title: Roving Storytime Childrens Week
item.description:
Roving Storytime is an annual event held during Children's Week by Swan Hill Regional Library.
Starting at the library, children will be guided on a walk along the main street of Swan Hill, where they will find out all about the people in their neighbourhood. There will be stories read along the way, nursery rhymes sung and lots of fun to be had!
After a special visit from the Police, CFA and Ambulance, children will complete their walk back at the library followed by a morning tea.
This is a free event, starting at 10:30am.
Children will need a hat, comfortable shoes, water bottle and sunscreen. All children must be accompanied by a parent or career.
For more information please contact Swan Hill Regional Library.

item.title: Free Concert at Melbourne Recital Centre: Jiangsu Folk Music Orchestra
item.description:
Music lovers of all ages are invited to a free concert at Melbourne Recital Centre by the internationally acclaimed Jiangsu Folk Music Orchestra.
The exclusive event, which will celebrate the 35th anniversary of Victoria's sister-state relationship with China's Jiangsu province, will feature traditional Jiangnan, Guangdong and Northern Chinese music by award winning performers.
The Victoria-Jiangsu sister-state partnership is Victoria's oldest and most enduring, as well as one of the first sister-state agreements between Australia and China. This concert is one of a series of events in Victoria and Jiangsu to mark the anniversary.
Tickets are free but registration is essential.

ns0:venue.name: Elisabeth Murdoch Hall, Melbourne Recital Centre

image.altText: The Jiangsu Folk Music Orchestra on stage holding their instruments
The Jiangsu Folk Music Orchestra on stage holding their instruments

item.title: Goanna Run
item.description:
The Goanna Run is a Rod Run and Kustom Kulture Festival. It embraces hot rods and custom type vehicles as well as the lifestyle aspects associated with this culture, including fashion, hair and makeup, art, music, dance and automotive styling.
On Saturday night Mildura City restaurants and traders are joining in and styling up providing a unique experience for visitors and locals alike.
On the Sunday at the Gateway Tavern you can take a leisurely stroll and get up close to the hot rods and talk to the owners.

item.title: HAPA Children's Day in the Park
item.description:
HAPA Children's Day is an annual event run by the Hastings Area Preschool Association. The local preschools get together and celebrate children and childhood by providing free fun activities and entertainment for children and their families.
Activities will include paper bag making, crowns and tiaras, sensory experiences such as play dough, bubbles, threading, sand play and much much more.
Entertainment will include emergency services displays, live music, face painting and information stalls from other local childhood services.
The event will be held at Hastings Foreshore between 9am and 1pm.

ns0:venue.name: HAPA Children's Day in the Park

item.title: Christina Thwaites – Body Transformations
item.description:
In a new body of work Christina Thwaites explores the female body and the transformations that it is able to undergo.
In the past Thwaites has often utilised old photographs for her painted works, attracted by the routinely serious, stiff and awkward nature of the sitters. One's awareness of their own body and its presentation to others is integral to these images and informs Thwaites painitngs.
In her current series of work Thwaites is again attracted to the body and the postures it assumes, this time however, her work has been heavily influence by her own body. Pregnant with her first child, the artist has discovered the elastic nature of the body and ones emotional state. Although not self-portraits the artists new works explore this transitory period and the physical and emotion relationships that are formed.

item.title: Hamish Carr – Perpetual Present
item.description:
Perpetual present is Hamish Carr's second solo exhibition with Anna Pappas Gallery. This recent body of work continues his interest in contemporary modes of communication specifically the creation of digital networks and virtual communities. Envisaging these interactions in formation has formed the basis to activate a reality specific to his practice.
The work for this exhibition has developed through the adaptation of etchings, digital technologies and topographic methods. These recent paintings employ both concerted and gestural applications of medium. This combination enables Carr to create a fluid and transient environment.
Hamish Carr was born in Rochester, New York and lives and works in Melbourne Australia. In 2009 he completed a Master of Fine Arts (Research) at the Victorian College of Arts, University of Melbourne. In 2011 he undertook an artist residency at Youkobo Art Space, Tokyo, and was a participating artist in the Australia-Japan Immanent Landscape Project at the Kurumaya Museum of Art, Oyama City Tochigi.
Carr has been the recipient of an Australia Council Grant (2012) and an Arts Victoria Cultural Exchange Grant (2011). He has been short-listed for numerous art prizes including the John Leslie Art Prize (2014), Tattersall's Landscape Art Prize (2014), the Fleurieu Art Prize (2013) Geelong Contemporary Art Prize (2012, 2008), and the R&M McGivern Art Prize (2012).
His work is included in the following public collections, Artbank, Bullseye Glass USA, Geelong Gallery and the Museum für Gestaltung, Zürich, Switzerland.
Opening drinks for the exhibition are on Thursday 9 October.

item.title: Universal Children's Day Celebrations
item.description:
Universal Children's Day for Children is an annual Children's Week event which celebrates the value of early education, play-based experiences and diversity in early childhood development.
A group of services along with Hume City Council, come together each year to host Universal Children's Day for Children, to celebrate children and families, and to highlight the importance of early childhood education.
Universal Children's Day is especially for children between the ages of zero and five years of age to experience a number of fun play-based activities which are age appropriate and emphasise the different aspects of early childhood learning and development.
For further booking information and parking details, please contact operator. The event hours are 11am until 2pm. Travel by public transport is recommended.

address.address1: Corner Pearcedale Parade and Dimboola Road

item.title: Field and Game Australia National Carnival
item.description:
The National Carnival is Field and Game Australia's (FGA) biggest event of the year. For two days, over 500 clay target shooters will come to the Seymour Field and Game range, in the scenic hills just outside of Avenel, to compete for a share in $60,000 in prizes.
The 2014 FGA National Carnival showcases some of the country's best shooters, with competitors travelling from all over the nation. Come along and see some of Australia's best take aim at the clay!
Bring the family and grab a BBQ lunch from Seymour Field and Game canteen, and visit the stalls from their sponsors and partners: Beretta, Winchester, GB Corsivia, Swarovski Optik and the Australian Deer Association, among others.
Spectator entry is free. Come along and watch the clays fly, and learn some more about this fun, sociable sport.

image.altText: Young Seymour Shooters at the 2012 National Carnival
Young Seymour Shooters at the 2012 National Carnival
Some of the Winners from the 2013 National Carnival
Some of the Winners from the 2013 National Carnival
Anthony Panetta, winner of the 2013 FGA National Carnival
Anthony Panetta, winner of the 2013 FGA National Carnival

item.title: Frankston Toy Library Family Fun Day
item.description:
Frankston Toy Library will open its doors in honour of Children's Week. Everyone is invited to come along and visit one of Australia's largest Toy Libraries. There will be lots of toys to play with, family friendly activities and cute animals to cuddle. All of the family friendly activities are free.
Family Fun Day will be held from 10am till 3pm on Friday October 24th 2014.

item.title: Carrum Regatta
item.description:
The Carrum Regatta will be held at Nagambie Lakes in North East Victoria. Jump in your car or hop on the train or bus because Nagambie is a region of wine, waterways, wetlands and wildlife only 90 minutes from Melbourne and only 40 minutes from Shepparton.
At its heart, the township of Nagambie offers a huge range of outdoor activities (both on and off the lake!) and is host to regular rowing regattas including the prestigious Victorian State Championships. If you're looking for a day trip, weekend escape, event location or tree change: here it is!

item.title: Children's Week - Free Family Fun Day at the Potato Shed
item.description:
The 2013 Family Fun Day attracted over 6,000 visitors. Come along and find out why! With heaps of activities, Family Fun Day is a great celebration of family life.
This popular event, now in its sixth year, kicks off the Bellarine Peninsula's Children's Week events and includes free festivities such as performance, music, storytelling and workshops.
This year local children's entertainers, The Mik Maks will return by popular demand as well as the ever popular Bungee Run, skate park, animal farm and much, much more.
New to this year's program the spectacular (but not too serious) circus performers, Pants Down Circus will be entertaining the crowds and we have also added a new 'Sports Zone' which will include a number of local sporting clubs providing activities through the day.
Fun and festivities will be kicked off with a live performance of Pinocchio by Theatre 3triple2 for Kids in the Potato Shed theatre, be sure to get there early so you can fit everything in!
A wonderful day for families with children of all ages. Everyone will love the range of activities and the best part is, it's all free!
Time: 11am to 3pm

image.altText: Free Family Fun Day @ The Potato Shed
Free Family Fun Day @ The Potato Shed

item.title: Wodonga Children's Fair
Hume Murray Farmers Market - Growing for Life
item.description:
As part of Wodonga Children's Week 2014, there will be hands-on introduction to planting seeds for food and cooking healthy foods. Demonstration and some participation and, for extra excitement, a snake handler to add the chilli of excitement.
Venue: Gateway Village, Lincoln Causeway Time: 8am to noon Fee: Free Enquiries: info@hmfb.org

item.title: Wodonga Outdoor Fun
item.description:
As part of Wodonga Children's Week 2014, come along and join council staff to have fun in the outdoors. Children will be able to assist with planting, staking and guarding, mulching and watering plants in their own playgrounds. Demonstrations at 10am and 11am sharp.
Venue: Pam Stone Park along the edge of house creek, Heatherly Court Time: 10am to noon Enquiries: Andrew Griffiths on (02) 6022 9355

item.title: Baranduda Teddy Bears Picnic
item.description:
As part of Wodonga Children's Week 2014, this is an annual Baranduda favourite! Come and join the teddy bear parades, prizes, healthy treats, games and activities.
In the lead-up to Wodonga's Children's Fair this is one of the free activities for families around Wodonga.
Time: 11.30am to 1.30pm Cost: Free Enquiries: (02) 6020 8643

item.title: Ukulele Workshop
item.description:
As part of Wodonga Children's Week, pick up a ukulele and join in a fun, easy workshop with the Gateway Ukulele Orchestra. Bring your own ukulele or other string and percussion instruments. All ages and abilities welcome.
Time: 10am to noon Cost: Free Enquiries: Cultural development coordinator, Verity Brookes (02) 6022 9211

item.title: Leopold Playgroup Open Day
item.description:
Come and celebrate Children's Week with Leopold Playgroup! Visit their open day for free family fun, with toys, activities, face-painting, balloons, show bags, morning tea and lots more.
Playgroup members will be available on the day to answer all your questions. Come and see playgroup in action and find out what they have to offer you and your child!

item.title: Surf and Ocean Awarenss
item.description:
Come down to the Boorai Childcare Centre for an Ocean Awareness Session aimed at wannabe surfers and surfers starting out, beach goers and ocean lovers....
This workshop will be segmented into areas of:
- Ocean awareness - Surf safety, including correct equipment, being able to assess conditions - Surf etiquette - Surf hints and tips
Time: 4pm
This Great Ocean Road Surf Tour session is proudly supported by Bellarine and Greater Geelong Kids, and a part of the 2014 Children's Week.

item.title: Children's Week - The Great Wall of Flowers
item.description:
Children from the Ararat region will learn how to create colourful origami flowers that will ultimately form a vibrant 3D mural depicting a local, springtime scene.
The mural design, by local artist Mark Hughes, will be 'coloured in' with the children's flowers covering the entire surface, resulting in a spectacular and joyful celebration of springtime in our region.
Origami Flower making Stations with instructions and coloured paper supplied, will be set up in the Ararat Regional Library, Ararat Gallery, Golden Gateway Festival Children's Day, local Primary Schools and After School Care groups.

ns0:venue.name: Various Venues in Ararat Rural City Region

image.altText: Children's Week 2014 - 'The Great Wall of Flowers'

item.title: Bayside Library Services - Children's Events and Activities
item.description:

The session will bring a fun, interactive and entertaining story time, which will engage the young and old.
Baby Rhyme Time for zero to 18 month olds will be from 10.30 am to 10.50 am at the Sandringham Library.

item.title: Children's Week - Bayside Community Celebration
item.description:
All Bayside community and families are invited to celebrate Children's Week!
A family celebration will be held to celebrate Children's Week at the St Leonard's Uniting Church. There will be lots of fun activities for the whole family to enjoy.
The celebration will run from 12.00 noon to 3.00 pm.

address.address1: Corner of New St and Wolseley Grove, Brighton VIC

item.title: Nagambie Lakes Community Market
item.description:
The Nagambie Lakes Community Market has a fantastic atmosphere with regular entertainment a great mix of quality stalls.
The market, now located on the south side of the lake at Blayney reserve offers some of the best views in Victoria!
Held on the first Saturday of the month, the market offers a make, bake, sew and grow theme that insists on a level of Australian content and local produce.
Regular stalls include:
